text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Nintendo 64 is a home console released in 1996, created by Nintendo in collaboration with Silicon Graphics. It was the last of the fifth generation consoles to be released, competing with the Saturn and PSX. Equipped with a 93MHz processor, two 64MHz GPUs and 4MB of RAM (expandable up to 8MB), it displays a 640x480 image in over 2 thousand colors and 16 million polygons at once with over 150 miles worth of textures. Its main innovation was its controller featuring an analog stick and swappable accessories. It used to be the last home console featuring cartridges for its games until the Switch was released.
